required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implementing Technology-Assisted Drug Treatment and Relapse Prevention in Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs)
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing Technology-Assisted Drug Treatment and Relapse Prevention in Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs)

collaborator.agency: Center for Health Enhancement System Studies

brief_summary.textblock: Implementing a mobile-phone based system for drug use disorders in primary care settings.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the research is to study the impact of a recovery support system called Seva on primary care organizations, where issues such as coordination of care, job satisfaction, and the cost of adopting and operating new technologies are critical. The study will also investigate how to best implement this kind of technology into health care delivery systems that care for people diagnosed with substance abuse.

primary_outcome.description: The number of implementation milestones completed

primary_outcome.measure: Any Drinking Days in Last 30 Days
Risky Drinking Days in the Last 30 Days

Analysis for measure was done for the total of all three sites combined. Higher values represent better quality of life. This scare consisted of 4 questions that had scales ranging from 1 to 5. The scores were summed and values could range from 4 to 20.

Analysis for measure was done for the total of all three sites combined. Higher values represent better quality of life. This consisted of 4 questions that had scaled ranging from 1 to 5. The scores of the scales were summed and values could range from 4 to 20.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis for measure was done for the total of all three sites combined.
We analyzed computerized system log files to produce patterns of system adoption of the staff.
This includes the clinic operating costs and clinic implementation costs of the intervention.

arm_group.description: Up to 100 patients in each of 3 intervention clinics will receive access to the Seva mobile health system for drug use disorders.

intervention.description: Patients were given access to use Seva. This is a mobile application that uses social and behavioral theories to help support people after alcohol use disorder recovery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patient subjects must be 1) age 18 or older 2) meet criteria for Substance Use Disorder (SUD) according to the clinic. Clinician subjects referring patients will ensure that patients: 3) have no current psychotic disorder severe enough to prevent participation, 4) have no acute medical problem requiring immediate inpatient treatment, 5) are willing to use Seva, and 6) can understand and sign a consent form in English.
Clinician subjects include MDs, behavioral health providers, nurses and management staff from the clinics' primary care and behavioral health departments. Clinician must have an interest in the research objectives.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Failure to meet inclusion criteria above will exclude patients and clinicians from participating.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Seva - Patients
group.description: Up to 100 patients in each of 3 intervention clinics will receive access to the Seva mobile health system for drug use disorders.

group.title: Seva - Clinicians
group.description: We will analyze data of clinicians who use Seva (e.g. clinical adoption).

group.title: Seva - Madison Site
group.description: Patients will receive access to the Seva mobile health system for drug use disorders. Data on clinician participants were not collected due to the focus of the study being the patient.

group.title: Seva - Missoula
group.description: Patients will receive access to the Seva mobile health system for drug use disorders. Data on clinician participants were not collected due to the focus of the study being the patient.

group.title: Seva - Bronx
group.description: Patients will receive access to the Seva mobile health system for drug use disorders. Data on clinician participants were not collected due to the focus of the study being the patient.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Patient-centered medical home (PCMH) designation
measure.description: Three levels of recognition exist, based on practice sites meeting six standards. Level three clinics have the best adherence to the standards. Those standards include team-based care and practice organization, knowing and managing patients, patient-centered access and continuity, care management and support, care coordination and care transitions, and performance measurement and quality improvement.

event.description: This was a non-study related death. This participant died of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and emphysema.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
